name: Fighting Your Way To the Top Online Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Joan Crawford tries to make it to the top in "Mildred Pierce" by running a restaurant. Who plays her right-hand assistant?
questions.explanation:
Eve Arden.

	From waitress to restaurant owner. Good job by all of the cast members.

questions.text: A dedicated actor struggles to make it to the top of his profession in "Career". Who is the star of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Tony Franciosa.

	The enjoyable Franciosa turns in a nice performance. Boyd starred in the actor-on-the-rise movie, "The Oscar".

questions.text: Boxing as a metaphor for life is common in the movies. Kirk Douglas had one of his best roles as a boxer on the rise in "Champion". Who played his brother (and his conscience)?
questions.explanation:
Arthur Kennedy.

	John Garfield had a similar role in "Body and Soul". Steiger starred with Marlon Brando (as a boxer who didn't quite make it to the top)  in "On The Waterfront".

questions.text: In the western "The Mississippi Gambler", the title character sets out to build a great casino. Who plays the lead?
questions.explanation:
Tyrone Power.

	Easy watching. With John McIntire, Julie Adams and Piper Laurie. Not bad at all.

questions.text: In "The Young Philadelphians", Paul Newman tries to make it to the top as a Philadelphia lawyer. He does corporate and tax work, but ends up representing his friend at a murder trial. Who plays the friend?
questions.explanation:
Robert Vaughn.

	Good movie early in Newman's career.

questions.text: "Patterns" is a fine story by Rod Serling about corporate rise-and-fall. Van Heflin is on the way up; who is the man on the way down?
questions.explanation:
Ed Begley.

	Nicely done by these two - and by Everett Sloane as the tyrannical boss. Great career boost for a young Serling.

questions.text: Sports is a common setting for climb-up-the-ladder stories The best of the bunch is "The Natural" with Robert Redford as the baseball star. Who plays the "dark lady" that derails his early career?
questions.explanation:
Barbara Hershey.

	Superb movie. Other choices would include Paul Newman in "The Hustler" as a great pool player or Steve McQueen as "The Cincinnati Kid", trying to make it to the top of the poker world.

questions.text: "Of Human Bondage" shows the struggles of a medical student to make it through and become a doctor. Leslie Howard plays the role of the student who is obsessed with Bette Davis. How does he meet her?
questions.correct: She's a waitress in a restaurant
options: She's a teacher in another part of the school
She lives in his apartment building
She meets him at a party
questions.explanation:
She's a waitress in a restaurant.

	Good early role for Davis in the Somerset Maugham story.

questions.text: Politics is also a common backdrop for tales of ambition. One of the best of these is "The Best Man". Henry Fonda stars; who plays his major political opponent?
questions.explanation:
Cliff Robertson.

	Fonda is fine in his typical role as a moral man of principle and leadership ability. Murray stars in "Advise and Consent", another movie about political fortunes and misfortunes.

questions.text: There are several tales of singers trying to make it in the Bigtime. Doris Day stars (with James Cagney) in the biographical "Love Me or Leave Me". Who plays Day's would-be-suitor?
questions.explanation:
Cameron Mitchell.

	Nice dramnatic turn for Doris; Cagney is fine (of course). Ohrbach starred on Broadway in one version of "42nd Street" (about an actress hoping for the "big break"). Sharif starred in "Funny Girl", the story of Fanny Brice's rise to stardom that launched Barbra Streisand's movie career.
